title: Willson Contreras lands a dig at the Yankees ahead of his first season with the Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox "I’m not coming to Boston just to like the Yankees, because that’s not going to happen.
" Contreras should provide some pop in Boston's lineup.

AP Photo/John Bazemore, File The Red Sox traded for Cardinals first baseman Willson Contreras earlier this offseason to add some right-handed pop to the lineup and a veteran presence in the clubhouse.

title: Mass. resident targeted in crypto scheme on Tinder, lost over $500K, feds say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime Federal prosecutors are seeking to recover a high sum of cryptocurrency proceeds which are valued at an estimated $200,000.
A Massachusetts resident fell for a scheme that allegedly yielded 200,000.
039646 of Tether cryptocurrency in proceeds, federal prosecutors said.

title: Will Campbell has a candid response to critics after playoff debut with Patriots

title: New video shows Brown University shooter leaving campus after killing students
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News As the gunman briskly crosses the street and turns left, the shuttle bus turns right, revealing police cruisers with their lights on.
A screen grab from surveillance footage of Claudio Neves Valente fleeing the scene after committing a mass shooting at Brown University.

title: Ahead of Patriots playoff game, Texans’ top receiver missing from practice
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots Nico Collins did not practice on Wednesday in Texas after suffering a concussion on Monday.
Nico Collins has been one of the top wideouts in the NFL over the last few years.

(Photo by Dylan Buell/Getty Images FOXBOROUGH — While Christian Gonzalez continues to make strides in his return from a concussion, the Houston Texans could be entering Sunday’s divisional-round playoff game at Gillette Stadium without their top receiver.

title: 5 things to know about new Red Sox pitcher Ranger Suarez
author: Conor Ryan

Ranger Suarez doesn't rely on a blistering fastball to get outs.

title: Owner sought after dog found nearly starved to death in Lexington
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News A roughly two-year old pit bull terrier mix was brought into Angell Animal Medical Center after found emaciated in Lexington.

MSPCA-Angell By Carson Lyle January 14, 2026 | 6:34 PM 1 minute to read MSPCA-Angell is asking for the public’s help identifying the owner of a two-year-old pit bull terrier mix who was found nearly starved to death on Saturday in Lexington, the animal protection organization said.
“When this dog came in, she was unbelievably thin and too weak to stand up,” said Mike Keiley, vice president of the MSPCA-Angell’s Animal Protection Division.

title: Lexington police looking for missing teenager last seen on Jan. 5
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News Kayleigh McCormack, 16, was last seen at 13 Pelham Road in Lexington, the Lexington Police Department said.

Lexington Police Department By Carson Lyle January 14, 2026 | 5:45 PM 1 minute to read The Lexington Police Department is searching for a teenager after she was reported missing by school staff more than a week ago, the department said.

title: Patriots get good news on Christian Gonzalez’s health ahead of Texans playoff game
